byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Waco, Serge F. Kovaleski from New York, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta. David Montgomery contributed reporting from Waco, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ, SERGE F. KOVALESKI and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Approximately 170 bikers linked to deadly shootout between rival motorcycle gangs during meeting at Waco, Tex, shopping mall are charged with engaging in organized crime linked to capital murder; could face death penalty depending on what charges prosecutors and a grand jury settle upon; corporate management of Twin Peaks restaurant, meeting spot where battle began, revokes franchise agreement day after melee.
lead_paragraph: The suspects faced charges of engaging in organized crime linked to capital murder in a shootout among rival gangs on Sunday in Texas.

headline.main: 170 Bikers Charged in Waco, in a Rivalry Rooted in the 1960s
headline.print_headline: 170 Bikers Charged in Melee With Roots in ’60s

snippet: The suspects faced charges of engaging in organized crime linked to capital murder in a shootout among rival gangs on Sunday in Texas.
